title: Olaf Scholz is now the betting market favorite to succeed Angela Merkel
text:
Even if Scholz becomes chancellor, the mix of party composition is wide open and is likely to involve post-election negotiations. The favorites, so to speak, are a coalition of SPD, Greens and the FDP — at just 25% probability.

The German DAX DX:DAX stock market index has modestly underperformed the broader European market this year, with a 15% gain compared to a 19% rise for the Stoxx Europe 600.

The more telling action seems to be in the bond market. The yield on the 10-year bund BX:TMBMKDE-10Y rose as high as -0.07% this year, before falling to -0.5% as Merkel's center-right coalition had improved in the polls, but now is rising back, at -0.39% on Thursday.

“More fiscal easing in Germany under a SPD-led coalition government remains an upside risk scenario,” said economists at Goldman Sachs.

Thursday saw muted action in European markets, with the Stoxx Europe 600 XX:SXXP rising 0.2%.

The biggest Stoxx 600 gainer was biopharmaceutical Swedish Orphan Biovitrum SE:SOBI, which rose 26% after recommending a buyout offer from U.S. private equity firm Advent International Corp. and Singapore's Aurora Investment, worth 69.4 billion kronor, or around $8.1 billion.

Video games maker CD Projekt PL:CDR climbed 11% in Warsaw after a smaller-than-forecast profit decline. Its bug-ridden Cyberpunk 2077 game returned to the Sony PlayStation Store on June 21, and the company is planning new versions of Cyberpunk and The Witcher 3 late this year.
